Stem: Spreading, creeping or upright. Cluster together to form mats or masses.
Leaves: Feather-like appearance in rings around stems, larger underwater, up to 4 cm long, bluish green.
Flowers: Inconspicuous, tiny, white, with no petals, only 4 sepals (petal-like leaves).
FruitSeeds: Not known to occur in Australia, reproduce vegetatively.
Habitat: Slow moving streams and ponds, lakes, dams, wetlands.
DistinguishingFeatures: Large bluish-green feather-like leaves are distinctive from native *Myriophyllum* species.
Impacts: Blocks irrigation or hydroelectric water flow, displace and exclude native species, reduce biodiversity.
